guts.sim
Class SimUtilities

java.lang.Object
  guts.sim.SimUtilities

public class SimUtilities
extends java.lang.Object

Holds all the utilities needed to do some basic maths in a simulation. It provides the tools to have testable math without invoking your private methods or setting seeds in different places. Be careful about speed aspects. These methods do not provide high performance calculation, but docus more on an easy to use aspect.

Since:
1.0

Method Detail

getSign

public static int getSign(double value)

getRandomBetween

public double getRandomBetween(double smallest,
                               double largest,
                               double stepSize)
Returns a random number that lies between smallest and largest and is also a multiple of stepSize. The result is correct to ›this.precision‹ decimal places. The ›largest‹ number is corrected to be a multiple of stepSize.

Parameters:
smallest - The smalles possible number that the result may be
largest - The largest included number the result may be
stepSize - The number of which the result must be a multiple of
Returns:
A random number that matched the specification

round

public static double round(double unrounded,
                           int precision)
Returns a truncated version of unrounded. The result is corrected to ›precision‹ decimal places. 0.5 transforms to 1.0

Parameters:
unrounded - The unrounded number
precision - The number of decimal places
Returns:
The rounded number

makeGGV

public static double makeGGV(double a,
                             double b)
Returns the largest in common multiple of a and b

Parameters:
a - A arbitrary number
b - Another arbitrary number
Returns:
May return a if b is larger then a

setRandomSeed

public void setRandomSeed(long seed)
Makes it possible to test the other functions. Sets the seed for all the random functions laying with in.

Parameters:
seed - Gives a seed to the random object.

setPrecision

public void setPrecision(int precision)
Sets the number of decimal places for all the functions where you can't pass this number as a parameter

Parameters:
precision - the number of decimal places
